intro: Cyrtandromoea sumatrana, commonly known as the Sumatran sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the island of Sumatra. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its small, succulent leaves and delicate, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its unique morphology and limited distribution make it a subject of interest in botanical studies. Due to habitat loss, it is considered vulnerable, highlighting the need for conservation efforts.
